page.title: 08HOUSES IN WHITTON
page.content:
Firstly Whitton was a little village with small houses and cottages and the odd shop. In 1930 many new modern houses were built. Also the shops and the railway station were built at this time. In the last 20 years there has been more building- mostly houses, but some tower blocks. A survey showed us that most of the houses in the area are semi-detached brick built houses with tiled roofs. Some people live in terraced houses built in around 1900. There are some council houses in the area which were built in the 1920's. There used to be some large houses and estates in the area but only Kneller House survives. It is used as a Military School of Music although it may soon be closed.
NELSON SCHOOL
